ngiemboon: Alyɛʼɛ́ nzsè pà Yúndà gÿo ńtɔ́g, á gwɔ́ mbaʼámbaʼ na ndùŋmvfò lyɛ̌ʼ na ngàba láʼ, Malîɛ we Magndala pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ Malîɛ gʉa légyá lesyè,
en: After the Sabbath,   as the first day of the week was dawning, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to view the tomb.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńkúu wó, ńjúʼ tsetsáʼ pú ńcʉʼʉ tɛʼ. cÿɔ́ʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́ʼ, ńtó ńkite tóon gẅie mé ka lɔg ńjÿɔ́ʼ ncwò lesyè, ńkwɔ́ʼ ńnéŋe na tóon ŋwɛ́.
en: There was a violent earthquake, because an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and approached the tomb. He rolled back the stone and was sitting on it.

ngiemboon: À la ne ńkyɛʼɛ jʉʼ páʼ nně mbʉ̀ŋ la, menzsǒ mé piŋ ne fɔ́gɔ tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing was as white as snow.

ngiemboon: Papyɛ́b lesyè gyá púʼu, ḿvɛ, ḿbɔ́g, ńgwete ńnuŋte ssé páʼ mepfó la.
en: The guards were so shaken by fear of him that they became like dead men.

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gɔɔn né panzwě ngie: «Tà pi pɔ́g, n zsě ngie pi tóo léfaʼa Yěsô gẅie mé ka kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ la.
en: The angel told the women, “Don’t be afraid, because I know you are looking for Jesus who was crucified.

ngiemboon: À te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn wɔ́, à zimé na legwé páʼ à la gɔɔn la. Pi tó ńdíe jʉʼ gie pfó yé kaa wó tá ńgyá.
en: He is not here. For he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.

ngiemboon: Pi gwóon ńgʉa shwóŋ ngàŋakwò yé ngie: “À zimé na legwé, ngie à vɔgɔ́ Ngalílîa, ńne ńzẅíʼte gẅí lâ pɔ̌, pi ge kúu wó tá gyá yé.” Yɔɔn áa nò gie n kɔʼɔ́ ńgẅiin léshwóŋo gẅí.»
en: Then go quickly and tell his disciples,   ‘He has risen from the dead and indeed he is going ahead of you to Galilee; you will see him there.’ Listen, I have told you.”  # 28:7 Mt 26:32; Mk 16:7

ngiemboon: Panzwě gwóon fó ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè, ńgʉa létsẅii yɔɔn nò mbwó ngàŋakwò Yěsô. Ecÿɔʼ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ na pɔ́b, tá pɔ́ ne ńkága kǎg,
en: So, departing quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, they ran to tell his disciples the news.

ngiemboon: ńtóo légiŋ, ḿbumte Yěsô. Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «N tsyɛʼté gẅí! Pɔ́ ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé, ńkíbe mekwò mé, ńguʼte yé.»
en: Just then   Jesus met them and said, “Greetings! ” They came up, took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.  # 28:9 Mk 16:9; Jn 20:14

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Tà pi pɔ́g. Pi gʉa ńtsẅi né mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, ngie pɔ́ gʉa né Ngalílîa, ngie pɔ́ ge gyá wɔ́ɔn pɔ́ wó.»
en: Then Jesus told them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to leave for Galilee, and they will see me there.”

ngiemboon: Panzwě gwɔ́ mánzsè ne ńgee, etsɔ́ palÿɔ́ʼncù ná pie é la ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ lesyè gʉa tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á cʉ̌a, éshwóŋ metándá panuŋepwɔʼ.
en: As they were on their way, some of the guards came into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.

ngiemboon: Metándá panuŋepwɔʼ tóŋ mekemé láʼ, pâ pɔ̌ cúʼte, ńnéŋe ssé, ńkwaŋte, ńná mbwɔ̀ʼ nkáb mbwó palÿɔ́ʼncù,
en: After the priests   had assembled with the elders and agreed on a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie: «Pi ně ne ńdyé letsẅɛ́ʼ, ngàŋakwò Yěsô tó ńjʉʉ pfó yé, ńdɔg ńgʉa!»
en: and told them, “Say this, ‘His disciples came during the night and stole him while we were sleeping.’

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ̀ɔn lɔɔn ńké ńjúʼ, mbà peg ge zsé nò gie peg ge shwóŋo yé, ḿbɔ́gɔ gẅí légyá ngɔ́ʼ.
en: If this reaches the governor’s ears, we will deal with   him and keep you out of trouble.”  # 28:14 Mt 27:2; Ac 12:20

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù kẅé nkáb, ńgÿo páʼ mé tsẅǐ né pɔ́b. Áa yɛ̌ tá yɔɔn nò leen ésá jʉʼ, pà Yúndà zsé yɔ́b pɔ́ yɛ̌ nò tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: They took the money and did as they were instructed, and this story has been spread among Jewish people to this day.

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò Yěsô ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ la júʼu nò gie Panzwě pa gɔ̌ɔn, ńgʉa né Ngalílîa, ńkwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɔʼɔ́ sie Yěsô la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à la laʼte mbwó pɔ́b ngie pâ pɔ́ ge láʼ pumte wó.
en: The eleven disciples traveled to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had directed them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tá ńgyá Yěsô, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́, ńguʼte yé, tá tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńne ḿmʉ́ʼte mʉʼté.
en: When they saw him, they worshiped,   but some doubted.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóo lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «E Ssé leen ńná tʉ̀ ntsèm né mèŋ lélɔg sáʼ shúm sie ée tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ sie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: Jesus came near and said to them, “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi gʉa ngwòŋo ngwòŋ, ńdɔg pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńgÿo ngàŋakwò yɔ́ɔn, ńnuʼu wɔ́b ntse ná lezíŋ Tá, mbɔɔ Múɔ, mbɔɔ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a,
en: Go, therefore, and make disciples    of   # 28:19 Or and disciple all nations,   # 28:19 Mk 16:15; Lk 24:47 baptizing   # 28:19 Ac 2:38; 8:16 them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

ngiemboon: ńzíʼi wɔ́b létÿɔ́gɔ kwò na menò ntsèm mie n da zíʼi gẅí. Pi zsé ngie, kwàʼ mèŋ n ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà njÿó láʼ ḿmag.»
en: teaching them to observe everything I have commanded you. And remember,    I am with you always,   # 28:20 Lit all the days to the end of the age.”   # 28:20 Mt 13:39; 18:20; Ac 1:2; 2:42; 18:10
